channel.title: Port Foward?
channel.description:
Okay before i factory reset my computer i was running my server no problem! Ive still got my same no-ip, i turned off fire wall and added the port through exception. i type my gate way in the search bar and port forwarded there. i really am not seeing the problem so far! :palm: :palm: :palm:
I get this at canyouseeme
Error: I could not see your service on **.***.***.*** on port (43594) Reason: Connection timed out

item.title: Port Foward?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

Never turn off firewall add the ports TCP & UDP exceptions.
You probably have a ip that changes so try making a static ip
If the no-ip has not been used for a long period of time I think they no longer allow you to use it so try making a new one.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Foward?
item.dc:creator: @JoeBenton2014 JoeBenton2014
item.description:
@JoeBenton2014 wrote:

[b]Now you have given me that information, I have full access to your computer within a few clicks of my mouse.

1.TURN YOUR FIREWALL ON AT ONCE!
2.USE YOUR INTERNET MANAGER TO OPEN PORTS.
3.NEVER DO THE SAME PROCESS AGAIN.

Search, ipconfig in comand prompt. Get your ipv4 adress, and paste it in your browser search bar.

You should get a internet manager, find out how to port forward with your router and do that process.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Foward?
item.dc:creator: @Coldmedicine Coldmedicine
item.description:
@Coldmedicine wrote:

  1. Do never disable firewall completely, just add exceptions.
  2. No-Ip is only nessesary if you wish to release your server, and then you could also just put your IP in the source/client to 0.0.0.0 so this is completeley stupid, it only gives you another way to screw up.
  3. Make sure you donâ€™t use uTorrent if you have access to your router.
  4. Check your virus scanner.

Good luck.

Read full topic
